title: Leslie Mah
text:
Leslie Mah is an American musician and performer.
Biography.
Mah first began performing with <a href="Anti-Scrunti%20Faction">Anti-Scrunti Faction</a>, a <a href="hardcore%20punk">hardcore punk</a> band based in <a href="Boulder%2C%20Colorado">Boulder, Colorado</a> which she co-founded with Tracie Thomas. The group first appeared on the <a href="Flipside%20%28fanzine%29">Flipside</a> <a href="fanzine">fanzine</a> compilation, "Flipside Vinyl Fanzine Vol.1" in 1984 and, in 1985, released one single and an album, "Damsels In Distress", on Flipside. The two lead performers and songwriters, Mah and Thomas, were part of the formation of the early <a href="Queercore">Queercore</a> movement, appearing in the seminal zine "<a href="J.D.s">J.D.s</a>", and starred and performed in "<a href="The%20Yo-Yo%20Gang">The Yo-Yo Gang</a>" by <a href="G.B.%20Jones">G.B. Jones</a>, released in 1992.
In 1988, Mah moved to <a href="San%20Francisco">San Francisco</a> and helped found another of the pioneering queercore <a href="Punk%20rock">punk</a> bands, <a href="Tribe%208">Tribe 8</a>, for which she played guitar. The group released their first single on Harp Records, following up with EPS on fledgling queercore label <a href="Outpunk">Outpunk</a> and were later signed to the <a href="independent%20record%20label">independent record label</a> <a href="Alternative%20Tentacles">Alternative Tentacles</a>, releasing a number of singles and albums in the years they were together.
As a band, they first appeared on film in "<a href="A%20Gun%20For%20Jennifer">A Gun For Jennifer</a>"; performed in "<a href="She%27s%20Real%2C%20Worse%20Than%20Queer">She's Real, Worse Than Queer</a>", which featured interviews with Mah, <a href="Lynn%20Breedlove">Lynn Breedlove</a> and other members of the band; and were the subjects of the documentary "" by <a href="Tracy%20Flannigan">Tracy Flannigan</a>, which played at film festivals around the world and won several awards including 'Best Documentary'.
Mah has also appeared in other independent films such as "Shut Up White Boy" by <a href="Vu%20T.%20Thu%20Ha">Vu T. Thu Ha</a>, and directed her own film called "Estrofemme". She has also performed with groups such as <a href="Grannies%20and%20Trannies">Grannies and Trannies</a> at the music festival Homo-A-GoGo.
Mah began working as a professional <a href="tattoo%20artist">tattoo artist</a> in 1995 in San Francisco. She is a founder of the Diving Swallow Tattoo collective in Oakland, California.
